attributes.action: Include More Female Role Models in Primary & Secondary Education
attributes.additional_details:
We need boys and girls to know that both men and women contribute to our country.

A lack of positive female role models is damaging the future prospects of girls and young women in the UK.

Girls must be exposed to a broad range of women, so that they can have aspirations and interests. They must be encouraged to make the right choices for them in future.

We need to ensure that boys and girls are brought up to respect women. Having more female role models will encourage children to respect one another.

rejection.details: The Department for Education is responsible for schools in England only.
